greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Multiplicative with a(2^e) = 1, and for odd primes p, a(p^e) = (e+1)*p^e.
comment: Dirichlet convolution of A000265 with itself, divided by A001511(n).

Although for all i, j: A003602(i) = A003602(j) => a(i) = a(j), it is not true that a(i) = a(j) => A003602(i) = A003602(j), because A038040 has a duplicate occurrence of a term on at least two odd positions: A038040(1875) = A038040(3125) = 18750.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..16384
Antti Karttunen, Data supplement: n, a(n) computed for n = 1..65537
formula: a(n) = (A000005(n) * A000265(n)) / A001511(n). [See the first comment]
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Jul 30 2020
